interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Ruby Sparks
Review Date: 2015/08/05
Store: Paul Dano  (Actor),     Zoe Kazan  (Actor),     Jonathan Dayton  (Director),     Valerie Faris  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Calvin (Paul Dano) is a young novelist who achieved phenomenal success early in his career but is now struggling with his writing -- as well as his romantic life. Finally, he makes a breakthrough and creates a character named Ruby who inspires him. When Calvin finds Ruby (Zoe Kazan), in the flesh, sitting on his couch about a week later, he is completely flabbergasted that his words have turned into a living, breathing person.', 'Amazon.com', 'A romantic comedy about love and control from the directors of', 'Little Miss Sunshine', ',', 'Ruby Sparks', "is an appealingly wacky story about novelist Calvin (Paul Dano) and his relationship with a fictitious woman. Struggling with writer's block and grieving over a failed actual relationship, Calvin looks to his brother (Chris Messina) and therapist (Elliott Gould) for guidance, but initially he finds only distraction and frustration. The therapist suggests an assignment that soon has Calvin writing about Ruby Sparks (Zoe Kazan), a fictitious woman who loves him completely and unconditionally. The only problem is that Calvin is becoming obsessed with his new character, imagining that he's actually spending every waking moment with this ideal woman he's created--surely a sign that he's losing his mind. When Calvin discovers that other people can see Ruby too, he throws himself wholeheartedly into the perfect relationship with the perfect woman. Then he starts to feel guilty about possessing absolute control over Ruby's thoughts and actions and begins to question whether Ruby really loves him or whether he is making her love him. Calvin locks away his manuscript and stops writing, and things begin to change between the couple. Eventually Calvin must decide whether he can be content the way things are or whether he must set his creation free--even if it costs him his own happiness.", 'Ruby Sparks', "is a romantic comedy full of laughably ridiculous situations, but it's also a thought-provoking film about control and acceptance.", '--Tami Horiuchi']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Zoe Kazan, Jonathan Dayton, Paul Dano, Valerie Faris', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 45 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'FOX2279153DVD', 'Director': 'Jonathan Dayton, Valerie Faris', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 30, 2012', 'Actors': 'Paul Dano, Zoe Kazan', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish, French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Fox Searchlight', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I loved this movie. It was bright, funny, and surprisingly serious. It was everything I had hoped for when I first saw a preview for it.
Review Title: I loved this movie
Rating: 5.0

reference_summary:
Cartoon Network: Chowder: Volume 2
Nicky Jones  (Actor),     John DiMaggio  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family
['Product Description', 'Cartoon Network: Chowder: Volume 2', 'Marzipan City is a place where anything can happen and the unorthodox is commonplace. In the middle of this bizarre city is a quaint little shop known as Mung Daal Catering, which is owned by Mung Daal, one of the ost accomplished chefs and well known in the entire world. However, things have become a bit hectic in the kitchen as of late, as Mung Daal has recently acquired a young apprentice named Chowder, whom he wishes to pass along all of his knowledge towards. Chowder is an energetic young lad who wishes to become the greatest chef in the world, but his love of food and his extremely short attention span often results in him causing unintended havoc. However, theyre not alone. Truffles works at Mung Daal Catering and she takes the orders that her husband, Mung Daal, must prepare. Shnitzel, a rock monster, also helps out in the kitchen as he has worked for Mung Daal for years. Along the way, theyll meet the many colorful and zany residents of Marzipan City, though there will always be new dishes to prepare and exciting recipes to follow.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Five more episodes of', 'Chowder', 'await fans of the surreal and sublimely silly animated television series on this delicious second volume DVD. As with its predecessor, the episodes are not in broadcast order, which has no effect on their enjoyment; each of the 22-minute stories (broken into two 11-minute episodes) stands on its own in terms of zaniness and visual charm. Strongest among the batch included here is the Emmy- and Annie-nominated “Burple Nurples,” which circles around a somewhat morbid conceit: in an attempt to make the title dish, aspiring chef Chowder accidentally laces it with rat poison, sending his boss and mentor Mung Daal on a mad quest to track down all of his creations. Other episodes underscore the show’s gentle blend of kid-friendly storylines and out-and-out wackiness: “Mung on the Rocks” gives Chowder a chance to prove himself by bailing Mung out of a pickle with his wife, Truffles, while its companion piece, “Sniffleball,” finds our hero facing the classic conundrum: will he be the hero in a game of sniffleball or the goat? It’s this inherent sweetness, mixed with the lovely, off-kilter artwork and characterizations that make', 'Chowder', 'so appealing to viewers of all ages. Extras detailing the conception of this unique show would have been appreciated, but only a gallery of sketches and designs are present on this disc.', '--Paul Gaita']

The Guyver
Jimmy Walker  (Actor),     Peter Spellos  (Actor),     Screaming Mad George  (Director),     Steve Wang  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Sci-Fi Action
['Guyver, The (DVD)', 'An innocent college student is thrown into a world of bizarre adventures after finding “The Guyver,” an alien device that transforms him into a powerful fighting machine. Mark Hamill (Star Wars) stars as a CIA agent who is determined to keep the secret device from falling into the hands of evil Zoanoids, humans who mutate into monstrous soldiers. It’s sci-fi adventure at its best, with epic battles between the forces of good and evil.', ']]>']

The Ice Pirates
Robert Urich  (Actor),     Mary Crosby  (Actor)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy
['Product Description', 'Ice Pirates (DVD)', 'Robert Urich, Mary Crosby and Anjelica Huston star in this glorious send-up of the entire science fiction genre as an interstellar band of pirates steals from the rich to give to the poor, helps a princess find her lost father and discovers a source of water to slake the thirst of the entire galaxy!', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'The amiable sci-fi spoof', 'The Ice Pirates', 'has earned a small but vocal cadre of admirers thanks to its go-for-broke gags and a healthy disrespect for outer space epics like the', 'Star Wars', 'and', 'Star Trek', 'franchises. An atypically goofy Robert Urich stars as the leader of a band of space pirates who kidnap a princess (Mary Crosby of', 'Dallas', 'fame), and then join her quest to find a mythical planet that can solve the universe\x92s water shortage. A completely game (shameless?) cast (which includes Anjelica Huston in fetching leather gear, Ron Perlman, John Matuszak, and fantastic film icon John Carradine) and Stewart (', 'The Philadelphia Experiment', ') and Raffill\x92s breezy direction help sell the funniest bits (most notably, the notorious "space herpy" scene, and the frantic time-warp finale) and make the more leaden jokes palatable.', '--Paul Gaita']

Tangled
Mandy Moore  (Actor),     Zachary Levi  (Actor),     Nathan Greno  (Director),     Byron Howard  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
['Disney presents a new twist on one of the most hilarious and hair-raising tales ever told. Your whole family will get tangled up in the fun, excitement and adventure of this magical motion picture.When the kingdom\'s most wanted - and most charming - bandit Flynn Rider hides in a mysterious tower, the last thing he expects to find is Rapunzel, a spirited teen with an unlikely superpower - 70 feet of magical golden hair! Together, the unlikely duo sets off on a fantastic journey filled with surprising heroes, laughter and suspense.Let your hair down and get ready to cheer for "Tangled." Bursting with never-before-seen bonus features, it\'s even more enchanting on Blu-ray Hi-Def.']

Ruby Sparks
Paul Dano  (Actor),     Zoe Kazan  (Actor),     Jonathan Dayton  (Director),     Valerie Faris  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
['Product Description', 'Calvin (Paul Dano) is a young novelist who achieved phenomenal success early in his career but is now struggling with his writing -- as well as his romantic life. Finally, he makes a breakthrough and creates a character named Ruby who inspires him. When Calvin finds Ruby (Zoe Kazan), in the flesh, sitting on his couch about a week later, he is completely flabbergasted that his words have turned into a living, breathing person.', 'Amazon.com', 'A romantic comedy about love and control from the directors of', 'Little Miss Sunshine', ',', 'Ruby Sparks', "is an appealingly wacky story about novelist Calvin (Paul Dano) and his relationship with a fictitious woman. Struggling with writer's block and grieving over a failed actual relationship, Calvin looks to his brother (Chris Messina) and therapist (Elliott Gould) for guidance, but initially he finds only distraction and frustration. The therapist suggests an assignment that soon has Calvin writing about Ruby Sparks (Zoe Kazan), a fictitious woman who loves him completely and unconditionally. The only problem is that Calvin is becoming obsessed with his new character, imagining that he's actually spending every waking moment with this ideal woman he's created--surely a sign that he's losing his mind. When Calvin discovers that other people can see Ruby too, he throws himself wholeheartedly into the perfect relationship with the perfect woman. Then he starts to feel guilty about possessing absolute control over Ruby's thoughts and actions and begins to question whether Ruby really loves him or whether he is making her love him. Calvin locks away his manuscript and stops writing, and things begin to change between the couple. Eventually Calvin must decide whether he can be content the way things are or whether he must set his creation free--even if it costs him his own happiness.", 'Ruby Sparks', "is a romantic comedy full of laughably ridiculous situations, but it's also a thought-provoking film about control and acceptance.", '--Tami Horiuchi']

profile:
**Updated User Preferences Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user maintains a strong affinity for animated content, especially within the Kids & Family genre, while also exploring live-action options with their step-son. Their recent engagement with a thoughtful romantic comedy indicates a willingness to expand their cinematic tastes.

- **Context:** A focus on age-appropriate media is pivotal, aiming to provide safe and engaging options for younger audiences. The user is committed to creating memorable family moments through carefully chosen films and shows, balancing family viewing with personal enjoyment.

- **Content Style:** The user exhibits an increasing openness to whimsical storytelling and humorous narratives that may blend lighthearted elements with deeper themes. This trend signals a readiness to embrace unconventional content that still aligns with family values.

- **Viewing Patterns:** Media consumption serves as a reward for positive behavior, showcasing an evolving taste for varied and engaging storytelling that includes both childhood nostalgia and contemporary narratives. Their appreciation for vivid, comedic portrayals enriches family interactions.

- **Overall Sentiment:** The user expresses positive sentiments towards family-friendly content, particularly those that offer adventure and humor. Their recent enjoyment of a romantic comedy, noted for its balance of humor and seriousness, reveals an appreciation for stories that can resonate on multiple levels, reflecting a desire to share diverse experiences with their step-son.
